news-item.title: SHRC Directive to Probe Groundwater Pollution
news-item.text: THIRUVANANTHAPURAM, March 17 -- The State Human Rights Commission (SHRC) has asked the District Medical Officer to conduct an inquiry into the complaints of the residents near Murukkumpuzha railway station that the groundwater in the area was polluted following the construction of the railway platform with urban waste. Commission chairman Justice J B Koshy has ordered to submit the inquiry report by April 18. The DMO has been given directive to test samples of the groundwater. The Southern Railway Divisional Manager has been asked to examine whether the platform was constructed in a scientific manner. The Commission has also asked the government to hand over the report of the technical committee which was constituted to study the issue. The Corporation secretary, the Southern Railway divisional engineer, the Groundwater Department and the Suchitwa Mission director were members of the committee. The complainants alleged that the platform was constructed unscientifically and that the groundwater in the area was polluted afterwards. The Kerala Water Authority managing director has been asked to examine the issue. The case was posted to April 29 for further hearing.
